label: Description
value: Bedcover in blue and white, reversible double cloth. Pattern of stylized detached flower clusters; border of grape vine design. Star in corner. At one side the date 1828 woven in and letter A.H. (?) – second letter not complete.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: double cloth

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 233.7 x 203.2 cm (7 ft. 8 in. x 6 ft. 8 in.)

value: Platemark/repeat:  22 x 16.3 cm (8 11/16 x 6 7/16 in.) Mat:  45.7 x 35.6 cm (18 x 14 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Marx

label: Description
value: Fawns grip rings at each side of a plain vase and pull back from it. they stand on a pedestal base decorated with leaves and a laurel wreath encircling the bottom.

label: Description
value: An unadorned hexagonal vase is covered by a turtle which forms the lid, handle, and spout.  Its tail curves down forming the handle, spout pours from its mouth, and the cover is formed by its shell with legs protruding beneath.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Marx; 1962: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A large vase with a wide, beaded rim. The upper half of the body has a smooth surface; the lower half, vertical ribbing, joined to a short narrow pedestal decorated with acanthus leaves and laurel. Three handles rise vertically from the bottom of the vase to curve in three-quarters of the distance to the rim.

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Parchment leaf painted with watercolors. In the center "Rebecca the Well" enframed by gold-colored outlines. Parchment is edged with a gold color on all four sides and between are scenes with floral garlands. Carved ivory sticks showing cherubs, plants and trellis work, wooden splints. Mother-of-pearl washer at rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Parchment leaf painted with watercolors, carved ivory sticks, wood splints, mother-of-pearl washer

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1962: Mrs. Robert Gordon McKay; 1962: acquired by the Museum.
Liqueur Bottle Cooler (Seau Oval à Liqueur)

label: Description
value: Oval with shaed edges and double flange for divider on inside. Lower half painted with scattered pink roses. At top, a wide band of turquoise oeil-de-perdrix pattern, wit reserves containing roses.

Unfinished study for an ornamental detail in the mural at the Boston Public Library

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle.  Two floral roundels (half only of one shown at right), and part of an arabesque shown above the link that joins the roundels together.

label: Description
value: Marly divided into six parts with molded relief scrollwork, and three oval reserves with florals are outlined in gilding, against a green ground. At center, hand-painted birds and trees.

value: soft paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

value: Japse rebozo in shades of tan and navy blue. Braided ends have warp fringe.

value: H x W (including fringe): 236 × 84.5 cm (92 15/16 × 33 1/4 in.)
Competitive Design for a Private Garage.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Elevation shows an arched door flanked by side doors with lights over them. Single upper floor has three windows with curved iron railings. Below: "COMPETITIVE DESIGN FOR A / PRIVATE GARAGE / Cooper Union 1911 -- Scale 1 inch equals 4 feet - J. M. Scheiner." Ink framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and India ink, with grey-brown water-color (mounted)
Advertisement for a Megalethoscope, Invented by Charles Ponti

label: Description
value: The advertisement is titled, Mégaléthoscope de Charles Ponti, with a picture below, and each part lettered. Above and below, faces of a medal awarded by the London Exposition in 1862 to the inventor, Charles Ponti. Above, a description and key in English.

label: Description
value: Fragment with a partial figure of a saint or angel in light brown and olive green.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: tapestry weave

label: Description
value: Tapestry woven clavi (band of shoulder ornament terminating in pendant medallion) of coloured wools and undyed linen thread on linen warp.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: coloured wool and linen on linen warps Technique: tapestry weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1962:  Jerome Eisenberg collection; 1962: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Woven textile fragment. Central design shows repeating anthropomorphic figures, each raising one arm, within a rectangular border. Below, two anthropomorphic figures against a dark ground. Braided border fragment at bottom.

label: Description
value: Globular body, painted red on lower third; on upper part yellow slip, with painted birds with flapping wings and dots on neck and breast; between them, two rosettes.  Crooked stirrup spout (broken and repaired).

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Charles W. Gould

label: Description
value: Bird-shaped vessel with stirrup spout; horizontal ovoid body with applied wings, square tail and head of toucan.  Square-section stirrup with rounded spout (chipped).

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Charles W. Gould

label: Description
value: Small square of light brown cotton, painted in two shades of brown. Pattern showing alternately an animal and a human shape. One selvage intact.

label: Description
value: A woman with long veils is seen walking in a landscape and holding aloft a headband with her left thumb.  Stylized clouds.  Border with floral ornamentation.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and opaque watercolors and gold.

label: Description
value: Bracken and hemlock twigs dangle vertically with offshoots springing out from either direction. Clumps of leaves, gathered in threes, give the stencil variation. Silk threads have been added to support the stencil structure.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu), and silk threads (itoire)

label: Description
value: Small drawstring bag in a flame stitch pattern of red, orange, pink, black and green. Bottom edge of bag has three tassels with blue beads. Drawstring trimmed with multi-colored pompoms.

label: Description
value: Narrow shoulder cloth (selendang) in green, grey and dark brown with an all-over leaf and flower pattern with birds. Border by fringe with vertical parallel lines gives illusion of a longer fringe. Chinese influence indicated by inclusion of the lokcan bird which is based on the phoenix. Fringed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Rectangular panel with fringe at both ends, patterned in warp ikat of red, dark brown, blue and off-white. Design of horizontal bands with rows of shrimps, lobsters, roosters, horses, and some small snake or 'naga' forms. Central band features patola-inspired design. Fringed at two ends.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave

label: Description
value: White silk gauze woven with a floral pattern is embroidered with a design of flowers, bamboo trees, butterflies, long-tailed birds, and herons in multi-colored silks.

label: Description
value: Red silk souvenir square from Chicago's Columbian Exposition has a design of buildings and a large pool of water in light grey.

label: Description
value: Border of linen gauze weave embroidered in yellow and red silk in a serpentine leaf and ribbon pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: needlework on gauze weave

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangular panel known as a ship cloth or 'palepai'. Embroidered in dark and light blue, dark red, and white cotton. Two instances of traditional "ship of the dead" motif, with pattern repeats separated by "tree of life" designs, although the two ships are not identical. Features a few animals, many human figures (on main deck as well as on outer extensions), and umbrella-like designs, which could be ancestor shrines. Used in naming, circumcision, marriage, and death ceremonies--ceremonies that mark new stages of existence.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton embroidery on cotton foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave Label: cotton embroidered with cotton

label: Description
value: Wedge-shaped piece of brown silk velvet as for a skirt. Asymmetrical pattern of geometric forms, fruit and s-curves.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: voided supplementary warp pile (velvet) in satin ground with cut and uncut pile

label: Description
value: Long narrow fragment with an abstract design of swirling cloud-like forms and lines crossing at angles, in yellow and brown on a coral ground.

label: Description
value: Silk velvet textile showing pattern of green and yellow arabesques with flowers and birds on a red ground. Right selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: woven with supplementary warp pile (velvet)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1962:Alan L. Wolfe; 1962: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Cotton square, possibly a head cloth (kain kepala), in dark blue, light brown, and white. Dark blue ground showing numerous white dots known as "gabah sinawur" or 'grains of rice'. The "semen" (curling tendrils and other non-geometric forms) and "sawat" (wings and tail of Garuda, mount of Vishnu) motifs are also used.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
